definition: to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly

sentences.english: Virus-infected emails struck fear into the Microsoft Company.
sentences.chinese: 携带病毒的电子邮件引起了微软公司的恐慌。

sentences.english: Panic disorder, for example, gives way to sudden attacks of terror.
sentences.chinese: 比如，恐慌症，总是出现突然的恐慌。

sentences.english: Panic disorder, for example, gives way to sudden attacks of terror.
sentences.chinese: 比如，恐慌症，总是出现突然的恐慌。

sentences.english: His extreme practices aroused the alarm and horror of European bloodletting physicians .
sentences.chinese: 他的极端行为激起了欧洲放血医师的警觉和恐慌。

sentences.english: I hate to get this pessimistic about the situation. It feels panicky and overwrought.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿对局势如此悲观，这让我感到恐慌和过度紧张。

sentences.english: The observers of such incidents remain under influence of apprehensions and trepidations throughout their lives.
sentences.chinese: 目击此类事件的人会被忧惧恐慌的情绪影响一生。

sentences.english: Don’t panic if your culture turns up positive.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的检测结果呈阳性也不要恐慌。

sentences.english: Incorrect interpretation of conclusions drawn from laboratory studies have unnecessarily alarmed some people.
sentences.chinese: 对实验室研究结论的曲解导致了某些人不必要的恐慌。

sentences.english: What someone else thinks is urgent can create a sense of people-pleasing induced panic.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为是紧急会造成一种取悦人的感觉引起恐慌。

sentences.english: So far, however, no one is panicking.
sentences.chinese: 但是迄今为止还不需要过度恐慌。

sentences.english: it raises unnecessary public alarm and personal anxi ety.
sentences.chinese: 证明这一点会引起不必要的公众恐慌和个人焦虑。

sentences.english: Some of the injuries occurred during the panic, when people jumped from windows or balconies.
sentences.chinese: 有些人由于恐慌跳窗或阳台逃跑时受伤。

sentences.english: The euro crisis is rattling markets and economies around the world.
sentences.chinese: 欧元危机使得全世界范围的市场和经济恐慌不已。

sentences.english: Local media are covering every aspect of the scare with a voracious appetite.
sentences.chinese: 当地媒体正在用贪婪的胃口报道这一恐慌的每一方面。

sentences.english: In panic mode, we fall back into our old habits.
sentences.chinese: 在恐慌状态中，我们又回到了我们的老习惯。

definition: to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
